required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reader Study of DeltaView™ Chest Radiograph Software
clinical_study.official_title: Reader Study to Demonstrate That Use of DeltaView™ is Superior to the Use Standard Prior and Current Antero/Posterior (AP/PA) X-ray Image Pair

collaborator.agency: BioStat Solutions, Inc., Mt. Airy, MD

brief_summary.textblock: A new software product takes two chest radiographs, aligns them, and then subtracts one image from the other. The resulting image represents an image showing any differences between them. The study is to determine whether radiologists using this new software perform better with it than when they do not use it.

primary_outcome.description: The area under the LROC curve will be compared for the chest radiograph interpretations done without the new software and those done with the new software. Improvement will be demonstrated if the improvement with the new software is statistically significant at the p=<0.05. There were 422 cases in the total study. 20 of these were inserted as "noise" cases, not to be analyzed. Thus there were 402 cases to be analyzed. There were 120 cases with nodules and 282 without a nodule. LROC is a method for measuring the success or failure of a method where there is a tradeoff between the detection of lung nodules that are there (true positives) and the detection that the radiologist considers to be a nodule where no nodule is present (false positive). It yields a single number that done not have a unit of measurement.

secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity will be measured. If the radiologists using the new software have higher sensitivity, statistically significant at the p=< 0.05, the use of the new software will be considered to have resulted in improvement. A decrease in specificity is expected.

This is a comparison of the radiologists working without and with the software. The false positive rate is the percentage of cases in which the radiologists identified a lesions/location suspected of being cancer at a location where cancer was not present. . A false positive represents a location selected on a chest image without cancer and, also, a mark on a chest image where cancer was present, but a different location, one without cancer, was marked.The radiologists could mark up to five locations on an image and had to provide a confidence rating for each. This analysis is of the single mark with the highest confidence level.

study_pop.textblock: Radiologists in community practice of radiology chest radiographs of individuals with or without a lung nodule

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For Radiologists: American Board of Radiology Certification and live within the Baltimore, MD-Washington, DC Metropolitan areas
For chest radiographs, evidence of the presence or absence of lung nodule confirmed by expert panel; adequate image quality
Exclusion Criteria:
Radiologists who assisted by providing cases for review
For chest radiographs: poor image quality

facility.name: ISIS Research Center, Georgetown University Medical Center

clinical_study.keyword: lung neoplasm nodule image processing computer-assisted

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruited by email 15 radiologists practicing in the DC Metro area. Used prior subjects and those referred by prior research subjects.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: discussion of project was done with each participant. Any questions were answered and signed consent was obtained. There were no dropouts of those recruited.

group.title: Board Certified Radiologists
group.description: 15 Board Certified radiologists were recruited from non-University sites. Each served as subject and control is a crossover design

group.title: Radiologists
group.description: Board Certified Radiologists working in the Washington, DC, Baltimore region

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Radiologists interpretations without use of tested software

outcome.title: Localized Receiver Operating Characteristic (LROC) Comparison
outcome.description: The area under the LROC curve will be compared for the chest radiograph interpretations done without the new software and those done with the new software. Improvement will be demonstrated if the improvement with the new software is statistically significant at the p=<0.05. There were 422 cases in the total study. 20 of these were inserted as "noise" cases, not to be analyzed. Thus there were 402 cases to be analyzed. There were 120 cases with nodules and 282 without a nodule. LROC is a method for measuring the success or failure of a method where there is a tradeoff between the detection of lung nodules that are there (true positives) and the detection that the radiologist considers to be a nodule where no nodule is present (false positive). It yields a single number that done not have a unit of measurement.
outcome.population: All participants were included for calculation of A-LROC and Sensitivity-Specificity. All radiographs were interpreted both without and with software assistance

group.title: Board Certified Radiologists Working Without Software
group.description: 15 Board Certified radiologists were recruited from non-University sites. Each served as subject and control is a crossover design

group.title: Radiologists Working With Software
group.description: Each radiologist serves as own control, working without and with software. This is the arm working with software

measure.title: Localized Receiver Operating Characteristic (LROC) Comparison
measure.description: The area under the LROC curve will be compared for the chest radiograph interpretations done without the new software and those done with the new software. Improvement will be demonstrated if the improvement with the new software is statistically significant at the p=<0.05. There were 422 cases in the total study. 20 of these were inserted as "noise" cases, not to be analyzed. Thus there were 402 cases to be analyzed. There were 120 cases with nodules and 282 without a nodule. LROC is a method for measuring the success or failure of a method where there is a tradeoff between the detection of lung nodules that are there (true positives) and the detection that the radiologist considers to be a nodule where no nodule is present (false positive). It yields a single number that done not have a unit of measurement.
measure.population: All participants were included for calculation of A-LROC and Sensitivity-Specificity. All radiographs were interpreted both without and with software assistance

analysis.groups_desc: Measure is the difference between the radiologists working without the software less the value for the radiologists working with the software. Thus a negative value would indicate that the the radiologists showed better results when using the software.
analysis.param_type: difference in areas under the LROC curve

outcome.title: Sensitivity and Specificity
outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity will be measured. If the radiologists using the new software have higher sensitivity, statistically significant at the p=< 0.05, the use of the new software will be considered to have resulted in improvement. A decrease in specificity is expected.

group.title: Radiologists Working Without Software
group.description: Radiologists interpret the same images without the use of software

group.title: Radiologists Working With Software
group.description: radiologists interpret the images using the experimental software

measure.title: Sensitivity and Specificity
measure.description: Sensitivity and specificity will be measured. If the radiologists using the new software have higher sensitivity, statistically significant at the p=< 0.05, the use of the new software will be considered to have resulted in improvement. A decrease in specificity is expected.

class.title: Specificity: cancer free cases correctly identifie

outcome.title: False Positive Decisions of Radiologists
outcome.description: This is a comparison of the radiologists working without and with the software. The false positive rate is the percentage of cases in which the radiologists identified a lesions/location suspected of being cancer at a location where cancer was not present. . A false positive represents a location selected on a chest image without cancer and, also, a mark on a chest image where cancer was present, but a different location, one without cancer, was marked.The radiologists could mark up to five locations on an image and had to provide a confidence rating for each. This analysis is of the single mark with the highest confidence level.

group.title: Radiologists Working Without Software
group.description: Radiologists interpret the same images without the use of software

group.title: Radiologists Working With Software
group.description: radiologists interpret the images using the experimental software

measure.title: False Positive Decisions of Radiologists
measure.description: This is a comparison of the radiologists working without and with the software. The false positive rate is the percentage of cases in which the radiologists identified a lesions/location suspected of being cancer at a location where cancer was not present. . A false positive represents a location selected on a chest image without cancer and, also, a mark on a chest image where cancer was present, but a different location, one without cancer, was marked.The radiologists could mark up to five locations on an image and had to provide a confidence rating for each. This analysis is of the single mark with the highest confidence level.
measure.units: percentage of marks not on cancers

group.title: Board Certified Radiologists
group.description: 15 Board Certified radiologists were recruited from non-University sites. Each served as subject and control is a crossover design

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The main limitation is that the experimental format for this study is similar to, but not identical to the clinical pattern of practice in that more data is recorded during the study than would normally be gathered in clinical practice
